stories.title: Atlantic Forest Restoration in Brazil
stories.description: The Atlantic Forest Restoration Pact aims to restore 15 million hectares of degraded land by 2050. Local communities and NGOs have already restored over 700,000 hectares using native species.

stories.title: Great Green Wall Progress in Senegal
stories.description: Senegal has planted over 12 million trees as part of the Great Green Wall initiative, creating new livelihoods and reversing desertification in the Sahel region.

stories.title: Coral Triangle Marine Restoration
stories.description: Community-led coral restoration in Indonesia's Raja Ampat has seen fish populations increase by 250% in protected areas, showcasing successful marine conservation.

stories.title: Mangrove Revival in Bangladesh
stories.description: The Sundarbans restoration project has planted 2 million mangrove trees, protecting coastal communities from cyclones while restoring critical tiger habitat.

stories.title: Yellowstone Wolf Reintroduction Success
stories.description: 25 years after wolf reintroduction, Yellowstone has seen cascading ecosystem recovery including riverbank restoration and elk population balance.

stories.title: Scottish Highlands Rewilding
stories.description: The Cairngorms Connect project is rewilding 600 square kilometers, removing fences and restoring native Caledonian pine forest and peatlands.

stories.title: Wetland Restoration in China's Yellow River Delta
stories.description: China has restored over 100,000 hectares of wetlands in the Yellow River Delta, bringing back endangered bird species and improving water quality.

stories.title: Iberian Lynx Recovery in Spain
stories.description: From just 94 individuals in 2002 to over 1,000 today, the Iberian lynx recovery program is one of the most successful wild cat conservation efforts ever.

stories.title: Loess Plateau Restoration in China
stories.description: One of the largest ecosystem restoration projects in history, transforming 35,000 square kilometers of degraded land into productive terraces and forests.

stories.title: Costa Rica's Forest Recovery
stories.description: Costa Rica doubled its forest cover from 26% to 52% since the 1980s through payment for ecosystem services and protected area expansion.

stories.title: Gorongosa National Park Restoration
stories.description: After civil war devastation, Gorongosa has seen wildlife populations recover dramatically, with elephant numbers growing from 200 to over 600.

stories.title: Seagrass Meadows Restoration in UK
stories.description: Project Seagrass has planted over 1 million seagrass seeds along the Welsh coast, creating vital carbon sinks and fish nurseries.

stories.title: Everglades Restoration Progress
stories.description: The $23 billion Comprehensive Everglades Restoration Plan is showing results with improved water flow and wildlife recovery in America's largest subtropical wilderness.

stories.title: Borneo Orangutan Habitat Corridors
stories.description: Conservation groups have created wildlife corridors connecting fragmented forests, allowing orangutan populations to intermingle and access larger territories.

stories.title: Patagonian Grasslands Recovery
stories.description: Rewilding Argentina is reintroducing jaguars, giant anteaters, and other native species to restore the Iberá Wetlands ecosystem.

stories.title: Kerala Mangrove Community Conservation
stories.description: Local fishing communities in Kerala have protected and expanded mangrove forests, improving fish catches and storm protection.

stories.title: Murray-Darling Basin Restoration
stories.description: Australia's largest river system is seeing ecological recovery after environmental water releases brought wetlands back to life.

stories.title: Tigray Landscape Restoration Ethiopia
stories.description: Community-led terracing and tree planting in Tigray has restored degraded hillsides, improving water retention and agricultural productivity.
